1. The speed limit is _____ when the yellow lights are flashing on the school zone speed sign.
2. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?

4. This sign means:
column6: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

column2: 5. If you begin to feel drowsy while driving, you should:
6. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column6: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.
column8: number of cars in front of you.

column2: 7. Warning signs normally are:
8. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column6: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

column2: 9. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: stay in the center of your lane
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 10. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
11. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As far to the right as possible.
column6: As close as possible to the center line.

column2: 12. When approaching a stopped school bus with its red lights flashing and its stop arm extended, you must:
column4: stop 15 feet away from the bus.
column6: stop only if children are present.
column8: stop and remain stopped until the red lights stop flashing and the stop arm has been withdrawn.
column10: stop and remain stopped until it appears safe to proceed.

column2: 13. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column10: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 14. When driving on wet roads, you should:
column8: drive slightly faster than the speed limit.
column10: drive 5 to 10 miles below the speed limit.

column2: 15. This sign means:
column4: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column8: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 16. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column6: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column8: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 17. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: stop, look left, then right, then left again.
column6: follow the vehicle ahead of you.
column8: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column10: stop, look right, then left, then right again.

column2: 18. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.
